task.title: Procedure: Disabling auto-scale on a VNF

sectiondiv.p: This procedure provides instructions on how to disable auto-scale on a VNF in CBAM.

context.note:
For more information on CBAM, see CloudBand Application Manager (CBAM) documentation in the Nokia Discovery Center by going to https://doc.networks.nokia.com
To disable auto-scale on the VNF:

step.cmd: Log in to the CBAM GUI.
In the CBAM GUI, click the options button with three horizontal lines, and then select Virtualized Network Functions. The Virtualized Network Functions pane appears.

In the Virtualized Network Functions pane, select the VNF on which to disable auto-scale and hover the mouse over the right of the selected VNF, and then click the Modify button represented by the pencil icon. The General Data pane appears.
In the General Data pane, Auto-operations are listed as item 5. To reach to Auto-operations, click Continue five consecutive times. The Auto-operations pane appears.
Select auto-scale and click the check mark button. auto-scale window appears.
Clear the Enable check box and click Finish.

info.p: In the Auto-operations window, the Enabled parameter for auto_scale is set to false.

step.cmd: Do the following to ensure that auto-scale is disabled in CBAM:

li.p: In the CBAM catalog, select and then click the VNF on which you have disabled auto-scale. The Virtual Network Function Details window appears.
In the Virtual Network Function Details window click the History tab. The History list appears.
From the History list, select and then click the most recent Modify operation. This operation is also listed in the Last Operation Status field in the left pane. The Parameters list appears.
In the Parameters list, click vnfConfigurableProperties and ensure that the enabled parameter in the auto-scale operation is set to false.
